Dont share anything linked to you. Dont show or tell anyone about your account. Then you will be fine. A while ago I had an account full of anything and everything I was doing in my life. How I was doing and feeling. My thoughts. My drug use. Everything. I mean *everything*. Well. One day about one week after I got out of the mental hospital, my mom calls me into her room. Apparently my friend knew my account and was worried about me. He told her my username. I didnt have anything hidden. It was all in the open. This was my absolute nightmare. Now my parents could read all about what I thought, felt, and did on a daily basis. It was horrible. These were my darkest days. I'm still in those days but my god that didnt help. Just pls be careful. Theres nothing good that comes from something like that. Just humiliation, shame, and pure embarrassment. I was an idiot. I wish I could die.

WRITING.TITLE: No title. I wrote this and for some reason I'd like to just share. I cried a lot while writing it. Its long. You dont have to read it all.
WRITING.TEXT: Say for a nice day. A person might walk outside. Its their day off. No worries or chores or bills or obligations weighing their mind. They breathe in some fresh air. The sky is blue. Stripped with faint clouds drifting by. The temperature is perfect and comfortable. Theres birds chirping and the sun is shining and there's a cool light breeze. Theres vibrant flowers growing, gently swaying with the wind while honeybees buzz around. Collecting the sweetness and fueling the beauty. This person smiles. This is life. And its great. Then I walk outside. I take a breath in. I see the flowers. I feel the sunlight and hear the birds and the grass is green and the sky is blue. I'm observing all the same things. But its different. The flowers are less vibrant. The sun less bright. Yet it scolds. Not gently shines down. I look at the grey spots in the grass. The birds are annoying. The honeybees are a bother. Maybe some days I dont even feel the breeze on my face. My shoes are a little too tight. The shirt fits just wrong. Birds are faint in the background. Almost like white noise. And there's a deadly silence. And a hollow chest. And my own skin feels foreign. Even dogs know. You now they say dogs are the best judge of character? My dog hates me. Her eyes don't light up when they see me. No tail wags. She looks the other way. I look the other way. And my ghostly existence floats to my bedroom. Where I spend my time looking at the intricacies of my carpet. And getting unimaginably intoxicated on various combinations of who knows what. So from an outside observer, I'm just a mean arrogant miserable person. Rare to catch me even smirk. And I sure as hell won't be doing anything with any passion or interest. My interests are drugs. Porn. And thinking existentialially about everything. I go months without even thinking about myself. Of who I am or what I wanna be or do. Maybe I dont even exist. I think its possible. Every time I try to die, I live. So whats the difference. The world will continue to cycle. The tides will come in and out. Under the direction of a pale senseless moon. And the sun will come up and down. People will live and die. Always both in the same day.
There's nothing wrong with that. Thank you lt;3

You aren't alone. Are you making any plans to change the nasty habit? There's a lot of great resources online right now. But also you could definitely talk to someone about it in person. I know it isnt easy. Even acknowledging you have a problem is a fantastic first step. Good on u.

I would have dreams of very graphic things happening to me and my family. It felt real. I was in rehab and I was even dreaming about getting high. Then I'd wake up and get pissed because I thought I relapsed and felt high. So I get how terrifying this stuff can be. Really though that medicine does wonders. I've also spoken to multiple other people that take it or took it and they said the same. It really helps.
